abstract.text: Creates an object that compresses video frames.

inlineContent.text: An allocator for the session. Pass
to use the default allocator.
The pixel width of video frames.
The pixel height of video frames.
The codec type.
A video encoder to use. Pass
to let VideoToolbox choose an encoder.
Required attributes for source pixel buffers, used when creating a pixel buffer pool for source frames. If you don’t want VideoToolbox to create one for you, pass
Using pixel buffers not allocated by VideoToolbox increases the chance that you’ll have to copy image data.
An allocator for the compressed data. Pass
to use the default allocator.
In MacOS 10.12 and later, using a
may trigger an extra buffer copy.
The callback to invoke with compressed frames. The system may call this function asynchronously, on a different thread from the one that calls
Pass
only if you’ll be calling
for encoding frames.
Client-defined reference value for the output callback.
A pointer to a variable to receive the new compression session.
The session outputs compressed frames through the output callback.

abstract.text: Work directly with hardware-accelerated video encoding and decoding capabilities.
A callback for the system to invoke when it’s finished compressing a frame.
A callback for the system to invoke when it’s finished compressing a frame.
A reference to a VideoToolbox compression session.
Creates an object that compresses video frames.
Presents frames to the compression session and invokes the output callback when compression is complete.
Presents frames to the compression session.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.
